original_query: Query 1: How are current relations between India and azerbaijan?

globals.search_results:
Found 5 search results:

1. Embassy of India, Baku, Azerbaijan : Bilateral Brief
   URL: https://www.indianembassybaku.gov.in/page/bilateral-brief/
   Summary: Economic and CommercialRelations. Over the years,India'sbilateral trade withAzerbaijanhas increased substantially from around US$ 50 million in 2005 to US$ 1.435 billion in 2023, withIndiabecomingAzerbaijan'sseventh largest trading partner after Italy, Türkiye, Russia, China, Germany and Israel.

2. PDFIndia-Azerbaijan Relations - Ministry of External Affairs
   URL: https://www.mea.gov.in/Portal/ForeignRelation/AZERBAIJAN.pdf
   Summary: IndiaandAzerbaijanhave warmrelations, based on civilisational linkages, cultural affinities and shared values of understanding and respect for other cultures. Highlights •Indiais the seventh largest trading partner forAzerbaijan, with bilateral trade at US$ 1.435 billion, in 2023. • In 2023,Indiawas the third largest destination ...

3. Azerbaijan wants Indian weapons, New Delhi ignores request ... - ThePrint
   URL: https://theprint.in/diplomacy/azerbaijan-wants-indian-weapons-new-delhi-ignores-request-through-friendly-country/2403536/
   Summary: Azerbaijanis the largest economy in the South Caucasus region, with a gross domestic product of $75.6 billion. In 2023, economic trade betweenAzerbaijanandIndiastood at $1.435 billion, which is the largest in the region for New Delhi.IndiaisAzerbaijan'sseventh largest trading partner and the third largest destination for Azeri crude oil.

4. Azerbaijan-India relations - Wikipedia
   URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Azerbaijan%E2%80%93India_relations
   Summary: IndiaandAzerbaijanhave age-old historicalrelationsand shared traditions. The Ateshgah fire temple in the vicinity of Baku is a fine example. This medieval monument with Devanagari and Gurmukhi wall inscriptions is a surviving proof of the age-old relationship between the two countries. The trade links withIndia, led to renewed contacts of the Indian merchants heading towards Europe ...
